headline: Mondelez’s Takeover of Hershey Would Rank as Top 2024 Deal
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Snack-food giant Mondelez International Inc.’s potential takeover of chocolate maker Hershey Co. would rank as the year’s top M&A deal. headline: Hershey’s U.S. Confection President Leaving After Three Months on Job
summary: Hershey said Del Pozzo will depart this week, with President and CEO Michele Buck assuming oversight of the business while the Hershey, Pa., company works to identify a successor.

headline: Candy Crush: Hershey's M&A Buzz Is Just The Cherry On Top
summary: Hershey's strong brand power and pricing resilience make it a compelling long-term investment, regardless of the potential Mondelez takeover. Click for more on HSY.

raw.headline: Candy Crush: Hershey's M&A Buzz Is Just The Cherry On Top

headline: Michele Buck to Assume Leadership of U.S. Confection Business on Interim Basis Upon Departure of Michael Del Pozzo
summary: The Hershey Company (NYSE: HSY) today announced that Michael Del Pozzo, President, U.S. Confection, is departing the company effective December 12, 2024. Michele Buck, The Hershey Company President and Chief Executive Officer, will assume leadership of the U.S. Confection Business while the company identifies a successor from among a strong pipeline of internal and external candidates.

headline: Should Mondelez Take Over Hershey? Not All of Wall Street Is Sweet on the Idea.

headline: Hershey Shareholders Shouldn’t Count on a Mondelez Jackpot
summary: Mondelez  is reportedly sweet on  Hershey  once again, but investors should exercise caution: A deal would make even less sense now than when Mondelez approached the company eight years ago.  Hershey stock soared 11% on Monday after Bloomberg reported that Mondelez has made a preliminary approach about a merger.  The Hershey Trust, which holds a controlling stake, has opposed past offers.
